DataElement.preferredName: Participant Report Adverse Event Relationship To Study Agent Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks whether the participant reported adverse event(s) that were related to the study drug.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Report Adverse Event Relationship To Study Agent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._A short textual account; having provided a short account._Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used._Related; connected or associated._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it; the activities undertaken during a study._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Related; connected or associated.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it; the activities undertaken during a study.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
